result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick Joseph Kottke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING JULY 24, 2015 AT 1:30 P.M. IN BR. 40.

miscConds.notes: Pay all Court costs, assessments and fees in this action during period of probation or to be docketed as a civil judgment. Bail to apply.
Court advised defendant that due to this domestic abuse conviction, he may never possess a firearm or ammunition.
Mental health assessment.  Comply with all recommended treatment.

No illegal drugs or alcohol.
No contact with the victim unless approved by the agent.
Not to possess any firearms.

Successfully complete a Batterers Intervention Program.
Cooperate fully with probation agent.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random screens.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Patrick Joseph Kottke in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Condtions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed ON 5/15/15 (30 days straight time).  rmm

Defendant Patrick Joseph Kottke in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements made as to sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 4:  The Court sentenced defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT OF 24 MONTHS, with credit for 5 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 12 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 12 MONTHS.  
.
AS TO COUNT 5:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 DAYS concurrent in the House of Correction, credit for 5 days time served.  
.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program; is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
.
Court IMPOSED BUT STAYED the Sentences and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months with the following conditions:
-Defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, STAYED, until next court date.
-Mental Health Assessment; comply with all recommended treatment.
-Successfully complete a Batterer's Intervention Program.
-AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
-Absolute sobriety-no illegal drugs or alcohol.
-Random screens.
-No Contact with the victim unless approved by the agent.
-Possess no firearms.
-Cooperate fully with probation agent.
-Maintain full time employment.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and fees in this action during period of Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.
.
Court advised defendant that due to this domestic abuse conviction, he may never possess a firearm or ammuntion.
.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Patrick Joseph Kottke in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

CASE HEARD BY BRANCH 6 FOR BRANCH 40.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 & 3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 1, 2 & 3 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 4 AND COUNT 5 W/O THE REPEATER ENHANCER:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
